info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 9:10PM EST until January 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 4 to 12 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust over 40 mph over the higher terrain. * WHERE...The southern Adirondacks, Mohawk Valley, eastern Catskills, Helderbergs, Schoharie Valley and the Lake George northern Saratoga Region in eastern New York, Berkshire County in western Massachusetts and northern Litchfield County in northwestern Connecticut. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down large tree branches and isolated trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates Sunday night into early Monday morning could reach up to 1 inch per hour at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
